docs.text: there is nothing like american history x in theaters or on video .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no other feature film takes such a cold hard look at the lure , the culture , and the brotherhood of white supremacy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nice guy ed norton jr . ( who sang in everyone says i love you ) plays derek , a twenty-year old skinhead .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dad's subtle racism grew large in derek , after gang members killed his father .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dad was fighting a fire when they shot him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now derek keeps his head shaved and has a giant swastika tattooed over his heart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek is more interested in the ideas of white supremacy than in its culture of violence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at a basketball court , black and white tempers flare .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek channels the aggression into a game , black versus white , for ownership of the courts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the choice presents itself , derek goes for game point instead of the sucker-punch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cameron ( stacy keach ) steps in to derek's life as a surrogate father .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he takes derek under his wing and nurtures his racist feelings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: keeping his own criminal record spotless , he uses derek as a leader and organizer for high-visibility racial intimidation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek obliges by leading his younger and dumber friends in race-motivated mob crimes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at the bottom of the chain , derek's younger brother danny ( edward furlong , made famous in terminator 2 ) joins the skinheads not for ideological or intellectual reasons , but because he admires his brother and he wants to belong .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one night three black youths break into derek's truck , which is exactly what derek has been waiting for .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: outside in his shorts and his tattoo , he shoots them all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the third would-be thief , unarmed , is only wounded .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the key scene of the film , derek commands the kid into a position where he can be killed with one glorious , enraptured , awful stomp .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( the fun-spoiling nc-17 of orgazmo seems even more inappropriate , considering american history x was rated r . what sort of country is this that says sex comedies are a bigger threat to our youth than brutal , ecstatic violence ? )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the police arrive just as derek kills the last thief .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek does not resist the cops , and as they spin him around to cuff him , the film slows down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek raises his eyebrows and smiles at his little brother in a chilling , sadistic , satisfied grin .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now in prison , derek faces new challenges .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the black man in the laundry tells him , " in the joint , you the nigra , not me . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a clique of swastika-wearing skinheads , but they are not interested in the ideology of white supremacy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they only use the symbols as a means of intimidation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: derek finds himself truly alone , truly in danger , and truly afraid .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when derek finally gets out of prison , he finds that his friends from the gang have also changed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: without derek's leadership , they have shunned the white supremacist ideology for the white supremacist culture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is the final factor that makes him realize how badly he's screwed up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the end , he spends quality time with is brother trying to undo the respect and admiration he had earlier inspired in danny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film ends a little too deliberately , too neatly after the unchained emotion and violent glee of the rest of the film , but it barely detracts from the overall experience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: edward norton gives an oscar-worthy performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although some of his dialogue seemed to be written without enough conviction , norton's performance compensated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( an example that comes to mind is his pep talk before looting the store . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he also captured the essence of an older brother .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he took his responsibility as a role model to his younger brother very seriously , very lovingly , both before and after his change of heart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: though clearly not for all tastes , this film is bold and daring .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the subject matter is ugly , cruel , and at times hard to look at .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nevertheless its subjects are part of humanity's great face .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kaye gives us a good look at this fascinating , if distasteful , american subculture .
docs.label: positive
